page.title: 17HIGHGATE INN HUNDLETON
page.content: The Inn owned by Mr. and Mrs. Michael Williams. It is five years old (in 1985) and caters mainly for local people and summer visitors. It employs eight staff. There are about one hundred customers a night, and the Inn can cater for one hundred and seventy. July, August and December are the busiest months, January, Febuary and March are not very good. There is live music, with the occasional "disco" - dancing to records. There is a juke-box, arcade games and darts. The inn is the centre for the local community's social life, and offers a range of food and drink, also to the summer visitors. Before becoming the 'Highgate Inn' the building was a very old four bedroomed house called 'New House'.
